ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I already took intermediate Spanish back in high school, so nothing in this class was new. The class was good for a review of more advanced grammer concepts and vocab.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I felt we could have done more worksheet-based practice with the grammar concepts we were learning to reinforce our knowledge in class. For the most part, grammar lessons were solely provided by the online VHL textbook, rarely being thoroughly discussed in class.
I thought this course was well paced, sometimes though there were weeks when we had multiple things due on consecutive days and that was a little challenging.

My strengths were speaking in class and talking in Spanish in class, and using the grammar concepts in activities. Some weaknesses are doing the online homework and studying for the exams in advance. What would've been helpful was better online activities and to have more of them, so I could've practiced the concepts and vocab before the exams.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Not really sure how to answer this b/c if someone wants to take Spanish they will have to take this course, but yes overall it was a course that I enjoyed.
No, if you dont have years of Spanish experience from high school or home you will struggle.

I would only recommend this course if they enjoy Spanish and have already know enough Spanish to do well in this class. If the student hasn't taken Spanish, I would recommend them to take a different course.
